poem:
### Charging in Addis

In Addis' haze,  
an architect rolls—  
his green machine silent,  
through power cuts,  
and city jazz.  
Skepticism sighed,  
what hum he holds—  
four months on,  
silently smiling  
in electric scenes,  
as hopes charge,  
this vehicle his  
unexpected bloom.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Powering up: how Ethiopia is becoming an unlikely leader in the electric vehicle revolution When Deghareg Bekele, an architect in his early 30s, bought an Volkswagen electric car this year, he was a little sceptical. Not only is his home town, the Ethiopian capital, Addis Ababa, prone to persistent power cuts, he also doubted the quality of his new vehicle. Four months on, Deghareg is pleased with his purchase since he no longer has to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
